title: Pitchfork Configuration
description: Configuration schema for pitchfork.toml daemon supervisor configuration files

daemons.description: Map of daemon names to their configurations

oneOf.description: Retrigger only if the previous run has finished (success or error)
Always retrigger, stopping the previous run if still active
Retrigger only if the previous run succeeded
Retrigger only if the previous run failed

PitchforkTomlAuto.description: Automatic behavior triggered by shell hooks

oneOf.description: Automatically start when entering the directory
Automatically stop when leaving the directory

retrigger.description: Behavior when cron triggers while previous run is still active

schedule.description: Cron expression (e.g., '0 * * * *' for hourly, '*/5 * * * *' for every 5 minutes)

auto.description: Automatic start/stop behavior based on shell hooks

boot_start.description: Whether to start this daemon automatically on system boot

cron.description: Cron scheduling configuration for periodic execution

depends.description: List of daemon names that must be started before this one

ready_delay.description: Delay in milliseconds before considering the daemon ready

ready_http.description: HTTP URL to poll for readiness (expects 2xx response)

ready_output.description: Regex pattern to match in stdout/stderr to determine readiness

ready_port.description: TCP port to check for readiness (connection success = ready)

retry.description: Number of times to retry if the daemon fails (0 = no retries)

run.description: The command to run. Prepend with 'exec' to avoid shell process overhead.
